events.title: Treaty of Paris Signed, Ending the American Revolutionary War
events.description: The Treaty of Paris was signed by representatives of King George III of Great Britain and the United States of America, formally ending the American Revolutionary War and recognizing American independence.
events.significance: Marked the official end of the war and established U.S. sovereignty.

events.title: United Kingdom and France Declare War on Germany
events.description: Following Germany's invasion of Poland, the United Kingdom and France declared war on Germany, marking the beginning of their involvement in World War II.
events.significance: Signaled the start of World War II on a global scale.

events.title: Pioneer 10 Spacecraft Launched
events.description: NASA launched Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make a flyby of Jupiter.
events.significance: Pioneered deep space exploration and provided valuable data about the outer planets.

events.title: First Session of the United States Department of War
events.description: The United States Department of War held its first session, overseeing military affairs and national defense during the early years of the republic.
events.significance: Established the framework for U.S. military organization and defense policy.

events.title: Explorer 3 Satellite Launched by the United States
events.description: The launch of Explorer 3, the third successful U.S. satellite, contributed to the early exploration of Earth's orbit and space environment.
events.significance: Helped advance America's presence in the Space Race and space science knowledge.
